intro: Ardisia fimbrillifera, commonly known as the hairy-leaf ardisia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia, including parts of Indonesia and Malaysia. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, giving it its common name. It produces small, white flowers that are followed by bright red berries, which are an important food source for various wildlife. Ardisia fimbrillifera is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and seasonal fruit display.
